ghostPost.plaintext:
Showcase code snippets directly from a GitHubGist inside the Ghost editor using
sensible embeds

If you want to share code examples that have been published on GitHubGist
[https://gist.github.com/]  then you can do so by copying the embed code and
pasting it into a card in the Ghost editor. 

GitHub is a reliable environment to host your code snippets, share your work or
find inspiration and every single Gist entry can be embedded directly into
Ghost. 

Create a new Gist
GitHubGist is a free community tool - once you're signed up you can create a new
Gist and start building your code snippet: 

Grab the embed code
Once your code snippet is good to go, locate the embed option from the dropdown
in the top navigation and copy the HTML code:

Paste it into a HTML card in the editor
Create a new HTML block in the Ghost editor on the post you would like to embed
your code snippet and paste in the embed code.

Publish your post
That's all there is to it! Ghost allows you to paste embed code directly into
the HTML block to share a Gist code snippet with your readers.

This is the quickest way to embed a Gist in Ghost. If you're using the default
theme, Casper, then this will look great without further styling. For other
themes, you may want to make some styling changes in your theme.
